results.description:
"Pagans & Witches in Greater Boston" is an open community intended to create public events for Pagans, Wiccans, Witches, Goddess Worshippers, Heathen, Polytheists and other like minded magical folk to gather and experience a welcoming and affirming community in the Greater Boston area.

We are a growing group of individuals from various paths coming together to celebrate, network, and work towards filling some of the greater needs of the Boston magical community.  It is our hope that this group can to be a be a focal point for fostering a greater spirit of community under the Boston Pagan umbrella. We offer a sacred and safe space to gather, meet others, communicate your ideas and join in public ritual and social time.

We do not adhere or promote any specific religious tradition. "Pagans & Witches in Greater Boston" itself, is not a coven or closed magical circle.  All who feel called to Pagan spirituality are welcome to attend, as long as they can be respectful of the space and each other.  Please be advised that all those who do participate in our open events and extended community are agreeing to adhere to our Anti-Harassment Policy (please read the full policy listed under "Files" on this meet-up page); actions, behaviors and intention contradictory to that policy will be strictly prohibited.

We do have opportunities for those wishing to take an active role in community event planning; please feel free to contact group organizers online or in person to discuss these opportunities further.


Blessings Always!
results.name: Pagans & Witches in Greater Boston

results.description:
Are you ready to bust through the blocks and limiting beliefs that may be tripping you up in life? Are you ready to stop listening to your Fear Voice? Are you ready to work miracles? This group is for people who are ready and willing to make simple, consistent shifts in their thinking and actions in order to improve all aspects of their daily lives, including relationships, finances, bodies, and self-image.

My name is Michele and I am the Organizer of the North of Boston May Cause Miracles Meetup group. I am a Licensed Independent Clinical Social Worker, a Life Fulfillment Coach and I have been mentored and trained by Gabrielle Bernstein to be a May Cause Miracles Practitioner!

The May Cause Miracles Workshops are based on Gabrielle Bernstein's New York Times best-selling book. Throughout the 6 week program, you will learn how to create beautiful, radical change in all areas of your life by adding up subtle shifts every day and week. Though each shift is simple, consistently choosing LOVE over FEAR will transform your life in ways you may never have thought possible. Workshop members can expect incredible transformation through the 40 day/6 week program and ultimately, a life filled with abundance, acceptance, appreciation, and happiness.

The workshop is offered as a 6 week program where members meet weekly for 6 consecutive weeks and each week focuses on a different chapter OR as a 2 day weekend program where each day focuses on 3 chapters from the book.

$250 includes:

Workshop (either once a week for 6 weeks or a 2 day weekend)

Your own copy of "May Cause Miracles"

Access to a private Facebook group for members to connect, support eachother and share struggles and accomplishments.

Unlimited email support throughout program.

20% discount on individual coaching packages with Michele

Please email Michele with questions michele@blisslifecoaching.net
results.name: North of Boston "May Cause Miracles" Workshops

results.description:
This meetup is for any single man or woman over 40 who would like to benefit from discovering the latest information about, and receiving friendly peer support for, navigating dating in today's social landscape. 

We will meet once a week for 10 weeks for targeted workshops, with additional fun outings to practice what we are learning and to have fun! The workshops will include guest speakers, multimedia presentations, homework assignments which help you practice what you are learning, paneled discussions, and more. 

Have you ever wanted to ask the opposite sex a dating question in a safe environment, and know you're going to hear the truth about what they think? Have you ever hoped to be able to sit down with a group of peers and be able to ask your own gender what their dating issues, fears, and expectations are? Would you benefit from open, frank conversations with men and women your own age, about tips and methods of finding the mate you are seeking? Stop struggling in the dating scene and start enjoying it, from a wise, confident, intentional, approach that helps you recognize what you are really seeking, and how to take more beneficial actions towards your goal, and to spend less dead-end time and energy on efforts that lead you away from your goal.
results.name: Merrimack Valley 40+ Dating Workshop & Fun!

results.description: This group will be following the format of Speaking Circles as developed by Lee Glickstein. A Speaking Circle is designed to give people the confidence and the skills to interact with others, to speak in informal situations, and to present in front of small groups. Examples of people that are drawn to Speaking Circles include: • People that get nervous when making a presentation or speaking at a meeting. • People that find it hard to make conversation at gatherings and social events. • People who lock up or feel awkward in social situations. • Anybody who wants to improve their speaking skills in informal situations. Imagine standing in front of any audience, feeling absolutely confident and at ease. That is what Speaking Circles can do for you. Whether you have public speaking anxiety or simply want to express yourself with greater clarity the experience in a Speaking Circle® will guide you toward effortless authenticity. Speaking Circles help: Business professionals become more effective, authentic and powerful. People expand their vision of what life could be like when they are able to be fully present, confident and authentic. People who suffer from stage fright to overcome their fears. At a Speaking Circle you are provided all the support you need to express yourself in your own time and in your own unique way, without fear or discomfort. Some call this depth of expression, “speaking from the heart,” “the authentic self” or “your real voice.” Whatever you call it, you know when you are there; you know when someone else is there. Use this link to read FAQs about a Speaking Circle. http://www.speakingcirclesinternational.com/Articles/Prin... See and hear participants talk about their experience in SPEAKING CIRCLES: http://youtu.be/Wi82ZIgioh0
results.name: SPEAKING FROM PRESENCE

The group will focus on young people who want more out of life then to sit in a cubicle watching the days pass them by.  We want to begin a movement in order to help to ignite all young people to own their lives physically and financially an, through our contributions, create Freedom and a lasting legacy.  We want young, open-minded people to come network and brainstorm about how we can break out of the mold of college, job, loans, working 86,000 hours, retirement...  How can we help each other to dream about and create the life we truly want?

We want all young entrepreneurs looking for a group to help give them the ability, courage and freedom to dream big and think outside the limitations of ‘normal’ life, the space to realize they can design and create the life they want, and the skills, confidence, framework and support to make it happen.

We'll meet a couple of times a month to throw around ideas and help eachother gain the knowledge and experience of thinking outside the box.  The meetings will vary from happy hour networking to business-type presentations. We encourage all members to present ideas to the group!

INFJ (introversion, intuition, feeling and judging) is a personality type that treasures the exchange of ideas and craves meaningful relationships. http://personalityjunkie.com/the-infj/ 


This group is not only for those oddball INFJs, but any intuitive type in need of meaningful conversation with good people. As Cornel West said in one of his rambling videos, “I'm a bluesman in the life of the mind, I'm a jazzman in the world of ideas. It's true that you might be socially isolated, but you're intensely alive." If this resonates with you and you’re willing to forgo social isolation, join us!

results.description:
Everyone knows a "Nice Guy." He's the great listener whose female friends call him a catch, but doesn't have a date on Saturday night. He's the husband who tries to please his wife, but whose marriage is tanking. He's the reliable buddy who everyone turns to for favors, but his own life's in a shambles.

No More Mr Nice Guy is a book and plan of action for men written by Dr. Robert Glover, a long-time psychotherapist holding a PhD in marriage and family therapy. The book is all about enabling men to achieve what they want in love, sex and life.

This group is for men who have read the book and identify with the "Nice Guy Syndrome". It's a positive forum for motivated men to work through the book's breaking free activities, discuss your experiences and gain feedback. We organize monthly participant-run workshops for members, as well as social activities for networking and fun.

Important: This group is for men who are on the path of self-improvement. For this reason, it's a condition of attending our events that each participant has read the book. If you have not read the book, No More Mr Nice Guy by Dr. Robert Glover is available from major booksellers and online.

results.description:
Welcome! Morning Star Sangha is a Boundless Way Zen practice group. We meet Wednesday evenings from 7:30-8:45 PM at St. John's Episcopal Church, 297 Lowell Avenue, Newton, MA. Plenty of street parking is available. We enter the church through the doors along Otis Street.  You are welcome to join us on any Wednesday evening, as your schedule allows. If it is your first time sitting with a Boundless Way Zen group, please arrive 15 minutes early for an orientation.

Our practice includes a liturgy (chanting) service, 25 minute sitting periods, walking meditation, dharma talks and discussions, and personal meditation instruction in voluntary private interviews with a teacher. Talks and interviews will be offered on alternating weeks by our practice leader, Boundless Way Zen Priest and Senior Dharma Teacher Michael Fieleke, and by visiting Boundless Way Zen teachers.

Morning Star Sangha is a community of Zen practitioners in the lineage of Boundless Way Zen, a school which combines Japanese Soto and Korean Rinzai traditions in innovative ways that include basic meditation practices such as breath awareness, mindfulness practices, inquiry into the moment, shikantaza (just sitting), and koan practice in the Harada-Yasutani tradition.

Check out our website at https://morningstarsangha.wordpress.com.
results.name: Morning Star Sangha

results.description:
Become the Perfect Partner While Meeting Potential Partners!

What if you could find the perfect partner today?  What would you say to them?  What would they look like?  How would they look at you?  How would being with them make you feel?  Imagine being with that perfect person right now.  

It's a great exercise to visualize your perfect partner, but while most people have a clear idea of who their perfect partner is, few stop to ask if THEY are the person that perfect partner would want to date. The fact is that creating a great relationship takes a lot of work. It requires skills. And those are things that we don't get taught in school.

We want you to be ready to step into that ultimate relationship with that perfect partner.  

So rather than going out on another random singles dating event, cruising OKCupid even one more time, or trolling the next bar, why not come out to an event where you know that the people attending aren't just looking for their next date, they're looking for "THE ONE" AND they're doing the work required to be "THE ONE" in return.

Each session will be a combination of skill building and getting a chance to meet other like-minded singles. It will give you the opportunity to learn about the other participants in a facilitated, non-awkward, low-commitment setting so that you have a chance to know people before you commit to a date. Andeven if your "one" isn't there this time, you've done something productive to be ready when they show up!

Some Topics We'll Cover:

Great Communication
Communication is the foundation of any great relationship. In these programs, you'll learn how to get deeper into connection with your partner. Learn the tricks to improving intimacy and learn the traps that can drag your relationship down.

Sacred Union - How to Have a Conscious Relationship
When you come together spiritually and sexually at the same time, you put yourself in a position to find that sacred union that can exist between two people. In these classes, you'll find out how to create better relationships, better connection, and a higher level of intimacy. 

Spiritual Growth
One of the things that takes us out of relationship quickly is fears, doubts, and insecurities. They are the biggest threat to us getting and keeping love in our lives. In these classes, we'll explore what it takes to really be comfortable in your own skin and how to let go of the fears and neediness that threaten your ability to have healthy relationships. 

Personal Power
In these classes, we'll be discussing how to claim and maintain your personal power. Personal power allows you to speak your truth, set and hold your boundaries, and face and overcome your fears. It's the foundation of any healthy relationship.

Energy Games
If you hope to create union with your partner, you'll need to learn how to move your energy and read your partner's energy. In these classes, you'll learn how to work with energy in a fun, hands-on environment. 

And More...
We will be offering a wide variety of classes to serve the needs of those seeking an intimate connection with their partner. All genders/orientations welcome.
results.name: Meet and Grow - Dating and Personal Growth Meetup

Are you a gay man and living on or near Cape Ann? If so, then come out and join your neighbors for a little socializing! This group is open to all gay men, whether you're single, married, partnered, "it's complicated", etc. We're open to well-planned as well as flash (short noticed) events - so if you're going out to do something, throw it out there. In other words, members are encouraged to throw an idea out on the discussion board ala "I'm taking the dog to Good Harbor Thursday at 2:00, if you want to join me..." or "I'm seeing _____ on Sunday the 25th at 3:00 at _____, reply if you'd like to join me." FOR ALL THE DETAILS on posting an event, please see the post "POSTING AN EVENT" in the discussion forum. (You can find the the forum by looking at the top of the page - look under the words "Area Gay" in the title at the very top of this page.)

Please Note: We're unrelated to CAMEN (Cape Ann Men) or North Shore Men, which are also gay men's organizations in the area. (North Shore Men can be found at www.northshoremen.org. For info on CAMEN, please ask the group owner Chris.)

I'll also be looking for additional moderators to help approve events - if you're interested, please message me!

-Chris

So let me start by saying it isn't easy to find like minded friends amongst the hippie-yogi-meditator types in the young generations in Boston! Maybe you're in your twenties or thirties and you find yourself becoming increasingly more spiritually expansive with time, but yet simultaneously feel less and less completely able  "fit in" with the masses of mainstream thinking. Maybe you feel like you need a "tribe".  My hope is that this group will create a space where the younger generation of spiritual, open-hearted, open-minded, like-minded free-spirits can come together to connect with each other, share ideas, merge the philosophies of East & West, and grow. Let's start first by finding each other. Are you a lover of yoga, meditation, philosophy, zen, buddhism, hinduism, spirituality, hippies, free-spirits, crystals or transformational festivals? This may be a great place to make some new friends and have some fun!

My personal background is I was born to a couple teenage hippies and grew up in a Hindu based cult in Montana. I've been exposed to the ideas of the east, meditation, yoga and philosophy starting at a very young age. I've experienced traditional "success" in the business world but find more soul connection as a yoga & meditation instructor and my studies and travels at various ashrams around the world, especially in India. I've had a variety of spiritual experiences and have a thirst for learning from new teachers, philosophies and spiritual walks of life of every variety. I'm as open-minded as they come :) Look forward to hearing your story too!

results.description:
Are you a burnt out stay at home mom or full time working mom who has dreamt of a lifestyle that allows you to put your children, passions, talent, heart, soul, and love at the center of your life? Have you ever toyed with the idea of starting a side business that you could possibly grow into a full time career/life passion?

Consider this group your built in sisterhood community + playdate generator for your children + business strategy think tank! Mompreneurs are juggling a lot and the energy of mother entrepreneurs coming together with their children in a community of sisterhood support is a POWERFUL FORCE! Meetups can include brainstorming sessions, ideas for work life balance, creative time management strategies (especially managing our KIDS!), raising capital, marketing plans, etc. 

My name is Felicia, I am founder of the Mompreneur Soul and have built this FREE community to give Mompreneurs everywhere the space to bridge motherhood and entrepreneurship, a thing that is not easy to find! You can find out more about my business here at www.mompreneursoul.com. 


A Little About My Background

Over the course of my career I have noticed how most of my female peers, particularly mothers, were missing from top leadership positions across the corporate environment but were showing up in huge numbers as owners of small home based businesses. I began to question my own career and life decisions when I started a family and began to realize that there is far more to living a "successful" life than just earning a bigger salary and capturing a corner office, and that as a mother, that all came at a hefty price. In the midst of the American epidemic of career burnout, stress-related illnesses and erosion of family life, I started to question how mothers could be better supported in their struggle to allow both their business leadership and motherhood roles to coexist and simultaneously thrive. 

The result was years of doctoral research aimed at understanding the Mompreneur phenomenon, a recent societal trend where mothers are choosing to leave behind either a full time corporate career or a full time stay at home mom career for small business ownership. It became clear to me after years of interviews with mother-entrepreneurs across the country that these women were discovering a “loophole” to the mainstream career issues that plagued mothers for decades. Whether they had left behind a career as a corporate executive or they had been a stay at home mom for years and wanted to re-start a career, I noticed the common thread for these Mompreneur women was that they got what their soul was craving: the ability to simultaneously be a mom and have a career on their own terms, without sacrificing one for the other. These women confessed it wasn't an easy road to take, but at the end of the day they called the shots, they had more freedom to decide when they worked on the business or spending time with their children and they chose businesses that put their life passion and purpose at the center. 

 My question then was how could I help power moms everywhere stuck in the fear and dysfunction of the mainstream career matrix successfully transition into entrepreneurship, and how could I help corporations who were losing these valuable savvy women leaders foster a healthier culture and environment to better retain and empower them. The answer to this question was the birth of Mompreneur Soul, a consulting firm aimed at nurturing a women’s journey through motherhood and business leadership and entrepreneurship. My background includes being a mother, corporate executive, entrepreneur, business professor, certified career coach, and Kundalini yoga and meditation teacher, and my life work and passion is to revolutionize how our culture, our workplace and business leaders everywhere re-think motherhood and leadership, and how mothers can infuse soul into their families, careers and businesses.
results.name: Mompreneur Soul Productive Playdates

results.description:
Modified March 23, 2015

There are many travel meetup groups, some of which are "for profit", and many commercial travel companies. There is nothing wrong with such groups and companies, but there is no need for another group to do the same  as they do.  The goal for this group to fill a different "niche", to be different from the others.  

The goal is for this group to be different in: 

1. Adventurous trips, whether in the U S or abroad. But that's not all we are, Some other groups do that, read on. 

2. This is NOT a for-profit group. I, the founder and original organizer, am not seeking any compensation for trips or otherwise. 

3. It is my concept that unlike some other groups, the "organizer" of a trip will not go for free, subsidized by increasing the costs of others.  I do not criticize other groups that work that way, I have been on some wonderful trips with some, but I'm going to experiment with this group being different. 

4. While the organizer of a trip will not go for free, it is my goal/hope that many others who participate in an event will share the planning. Perhaps one person will investigate air fares, another where to stay, another what to do there, etc. Time will tell if this works out. The work to be done by any one person may be as minimal as making a phone call to an airline, calling a hostel, or a few minutes research on the internet.  It's very little work if spread out, but a lot of work for one person to do by themselves. 

5. There is no minimal threshhold for how adventurous the trip will be. It may be to the wilds of Borneo or a weekend in Marthas Vineyard, biking and staying in a hostel.  This is not MY group, it's OURS. Are you looking for someone, one person or more to accompany you on a standard-type cruise? A night at a concert? POST IT, become an event organizer, just contact me to do that. 

6. In some situations we will be able to save our members a lot of money on great trips compared to other commercial companies and meetup groups. EXAMPLE: Machu Pichu (Peru). Typically, a trip there with a guide up the "Inca Trail" is advertised at about $1700 plus air fare. From my research, a gude must be a Peru-based licensed guiding company. Therefore someone here can only subcontract it out to a local guiding company. From my research, the best Peru-based guiding company is "Llama Path". They have almost 500 Trip Advisor reviews with an average 5 stars. I called them. Cost if booked directly through them, for a group, about $600 each (as of 2015 prices).      

Couples as well as singles will be welcome.  Some people would like to do this type of adventurous traveling but need someone or others to go with them. This is the group for that . Become a co-organizer and post whatever kind of event or trip you like. 

This will also be as a clearing house for ideas. If you have some great info to share, become a co-organizer and post whatever you like. 

Those are my initial ideas, I'm looking for ideas from others, some of which are already coming in. THe concept will not doubt change develop over time.
results.name: New England International Adventure Travel Meetup

topics.name: Single Parents, Divorced Parents, Widowed Parents

results.description: Divorce is one of the most stressful events anyone can face. It is an inherently painful process that can lead to loneliness, isolation, fear, anger, depression and a myriad of difficult thoughts, emotions and situations. While these terrifying places can feel traumatic, they also CAN BE THE VERY SEEDS TO TRANSFORMATION: a more hopeful future, a healthier lifestyle, a happier family dynamic, and a more abundant YOU! This Meet Up group is about WELCOMING those contemplating, enduring and recovering from divorce in the Greater Boston community into a fellowship of support and engagement about how to make the best of what feels like the worst. There really is no other way! Together, we will look at common themes/questions in topic focused gatherings through a lens of empowerment, such as: How can I channel my anger or other feelings in a way that won't hurt myself and those I love? How can I invest in myself and my future instead of being afraid of it? How can I protect the best interests of my children? How can I find new friends and build positive relationships in the midst of so much loss? How can I take care of my needs for intimacy and connection while still learning to take care of myself alone?  How can I learn from the mistakes I contributed to my past relationship instead of denying them, beating myself up with them, and/or bringing them with me into a new one? How can I cultivate respect and cooperation for my former partner who was part of so much hurt? In what ways is my divorce the loving choice? What/Who is my divorce allowing and inviting myself to become that I felt I could not in the context of marriage? ... Through sharing our ideas around these questions with good doses of open mindedness, compassion and humor, we can be incredibly empowering companions to one another on this arduous journey. I am a divorce mentor, spiritual director/companionship, former hospital chaplain, personal trainer, and published author. I am also a mother of two teens, and hope to bring both my skills and experience as offerings to the table of transformation, and expect that you will do just the same - not as experts, but as fellow human beings on similar journeys. This group is NOT a replacement for professional psychotherapeutic intervention, but a safe place for sharing our experiences and offering support to one another.  Meetings will take place at welcoming, safe communal spaces. The format will be casual, hospitable, with a focus on offering true presence to one another through attentive listening and mindful sharing. Confidentiality will be honored.  Many meetings will be limited in RSVP numbers not to exclude, but to keep the environment conducive to small group sharing.  Guest speakers with expertise in related areas will present from time to time, and resources will be offered for you individual interests and wellness.  If you are looking for an intimate community of companions to navigate your divorce journey for the best, then this group is for you!
results.name: Trauma to Transformation: Navigating Divorce for the Best

results.description:
PUSHUPS CHALLENGE TO SET WORLD RECORD FOR A CAUSE
 
Boston, MA (March. 1, 2015) – Families battling pediatric cancer gain support thanks to Pushups for a Purpose, an event hosted by Training for Warriors PVB and the Tom Coughlin Jay Fund on March 1.
 
For every push up completed, $1 will be donated to the Tom Coughlin Jay Fund, a nonprofit whose mission is to support families battling childhood cancer with financial, emotional and practical support.
 
The group will attempt to set a world record for the most people doing pushups around the world at the exact same minute in time. The Training for Warriors network has more than 29 countries participating in the challenge.
 
“We are thrilled to receive the support of Training For Warriors surrounding this record-breaking event,” said Keli Coughlin, Executive Director of The Tom Coughlin Jay Fund. “It is truly inspiring to work with such caring and committed people that support our cause to BE THERE for families tackling childhood cancer.”
 
To participate in Pushups for a Purpose, guests can attend the Training for Warriors grand opening event at 33 Harrison Ave, 7th Floor, Chinatown at 12:00 p.m. The challenge will take place at 12:31 p.m. Guests will also be able to enjoy food, music and giveaways.
 
For more information, contact Stan@tfwboston.com or 605-368-1766
results.name: Help us break a Guinness World Record!

My workshops are for poker players who want to learn more about cash game strategy.  I will discuss $1/2 No-Limit Hold Em live cash games - the most popular poker game in every casino!

We will be meeting in Cambridge on the Red Line, 2 blocks from the Kendall/MIT T-stop.  It is in a classroom setting for a small group of 6-9 people.

Topics will include:

position, calculating outs, pot odds, pre-flop and post-flop action, bet sizing, tells, bluffing/semi-bluffing, hand reading skills, probability, starting hands, selective aggression, 3-betting, check raising, implied odds, hand counterfeiting, slow playing, tilt control, bankroll management, and game selection/table selection/seat selection.

Please update your RSVP if you can't attend so that people from the waitlist can go.  After more than one no-show, you might be asked to leave the group.

results.description:
An innovative community is forming here in the Greater Boston area. It's called 'Oasis', and it's a place where we can connect, inspire, and empower one another. A place where life is celebrated, family is valued, and all people matter.


Oasis is, quite simply, a secular alternative to faith-based community. We want to give people the sort of community experience that many of us experienced in churches growing up, but without the dogma. A place where we can build a community with like-minded people, a place where we can refresh ourselves among people who share our secular, humanity-focused values. Oasis events are often described as a cross between a TED Talk and a house concert. In addition to these Sunday gatherings, Oasis communities participate in discussion groups, neighborhood potlucks, community service and charity events, all of the types of things you would expect from an extended local community.


Oasis is a place for humanists, agnostics, skeptics, atheists, freethinkers, deists, even some theists, to come together into the sort of community that has become the purview of churches, and to do so without super-naturalism or spiritualism. A community bonded by shared values, not shared beliefs or dogma.  We are guided by core values, which define our communities. They shape our interactions with each other, society, and the world.

Recent statistics put the number of “nones” (meaning those with no religious affiliation) at close to 20% of adults in the United States. At the same time, people who are openly non-believers are among the most distrusted groups in our society. Oasis is an opportunity for the Nones to have a place they can find a sense of community. A place where we can feel at home, unjudged, and valued.


Oasis is also a great option for secular families. Kansas City Oasis’s Executive Director Helen Stringer elaborated on this. “One of the most important reasons for organizing KC Oasis is children and families. Whether we like it or not, churches are pursuing our children. When my son’s classmates talk about going to a church youth function and how much fun it was, he automatically wants to go and doesn’t understand why we don’t. Lets face it, churches do a lot of fun things with kids: lock-ins, parties, group games, ski trips, etc. When I was growing up, these things were the highlight of my youth. The church wants you to believe it’s all the supernatural stuff that helps people, but the social benefits of belonging to a community is the real magic—a magic we shouldn’t let churches monopolize any longer. As a parent, I want my kids to have a safe place to explore their developing worlds view. A place where it’s not just okay to ask questions, but encouraged.”

At Oasis, our Core Values are:

People are more important than beliefs.

Reality is known through reason.

Meaning comes from making a difference.

Human hands solve human problems.

Be accepting and be accepted.


For a long time, churches have had a virtual monopoly on the types of community that we see forming in groups like Oasis, Sunday Assembly, Humanist Hub, and others, each of which takes a slightly different approach so there is a group to fit the needs of any non-religious individual or family looking for that sense of community.

It’s time for Oasis – a well of compassion and reason where we can celebrate life and, together, make a difference. A place where life is celebrated, family is valued, and all people matter.

Want an example of what an Oasis community looks like?

This article in the Kansas City Star, profiling Kansas City Oasis, is a great example of what secular community can be, and what Boston Oasis will be aiming for.




The Impact


Vibrant, tightly knit communities are central to human happiness and well-being; we are social creatures by nature. For this reason, we need communities like Oasis to provide a place to connect, be inspired and feel empowered. 

Furthermore, we need to provide a place where children can explore their developing world-views, ask questions and make friends in an environment that is supportive of critical thinking.



How we are set up to succeed

We are launching as part of the Oasis Network, a group of secular communities built on the same model. The Oasis community model has produced thriving, successful, diverse communities in multiple cities across the nation and we are confident it will do so here as well. We have received, and will continue to receive, guidance from Oasis leaders who have built their own communities, as well as documented best-practices drawn from their experiences. From this foundation, Boston Oasis will develop into a unique iteration of this successful community model. Boston Oasis members will be free to suggest activities and events which are in keeping with the Oasis Core Values.


Where will Boston Oasis meet?

While the Sunday gatherings will take place in a consistent location to be determined, there are certainly some ideas on what kind of spaces we will be looking for. We will be looking for locations which are accessible by car and by public transportation. We will be looking for locations with available parking. We will be looking for locations with good accessibility.Furthermore, it is important to note that Oasis events outside the Sunday gatherings will take place across the area where our community resides. Neighborhood Potlucks, Meetings of Minds (discussion groups), Game Nights, social events... all of these can and will be scheduled throughout the Boston area, typically with several venues for a single event on a given night.

Other Ways You Can Help

Want to volunteer?  Visit our website and let us know you would like to help!

www.BostonOasis.org


What is expected of members?

Members are free to participate as much, or as little, as they want. We have no minimum attendance requirement, no cover charges, no "probationary period". We ask that you come to one of our events, if you like it... come to another one!
results.name: Greater Boston Oasis Meetup

So... if you want to join a parent's group, but dread the inevitable small talk, gossip, etc. If you want a fellow parent to talk to for some support, but don’t feel like having to be ultra-social on a continuing basis, or if you ever feel judged or out of place a standard parents'/playgroups… This group is for you. results.description: The UX Lab is a group for anyone interested in strengthening their user experience design skills. The group was started in NYC and is now expanding out to build more like-minded communities. We want to meet other UX designers and create a lab-like environment where we could bring our works-in-progress and help each other brainstorm, prototype, learn how to use various tools/software, perform some usability testing and get/give feedback. Let's hone our craft by getting together and practicing good UX design :)
results.name: The UX Lab BOS

results.description: Whether you join us for your first 5K or 20th half marathon, whether you're crushing PRs or walking with friends, our goal is to make sure you have a Wicked Fun Running experience. We partner with sponsors and vendors who share our commitment to healthy lifestyles, charitable giving, community involvement, friendly competition and having Wicked Fun. Each Wicked Fun Running Event offers - USATF sanctioning ensuring rules and regulations of the sport and providing a safe environment for participants and spectators - A road or trail route that is tested and pre-approved by our team of experienced runners - Discounted youth entry fees - Timely awards ceremonies and great prizes - Great music to inspire you as you pump up, cross the finish line, revel in your achievements and cheer on friends - An after-party to celebrate all who ran, walked, and volunteered and made it Wicked Fun
results.name: Wicked Fun Running Events

results.description: This Meetup group will have one goal: Bringing people in Boston together for shared outdoor experiences, and the occasional happy hour! Our group will mainly be in the 18 to mid 30's age range but we are open! This will be a very active group and include: Running, Yoga, Mountain Biking, Rock Climbing, Skiing, Snowboarding, Drinking Beer, Socializing, Trail Running, Hiking and..well you get the point, anything adventurous and outdoors.  We will be cross-posting on other networks in order make the most of our time outdoors! Excited to meet you all!!
results.name: Boston's Young, Active and Adventurous

results.description: This is what you make of it! Wisdom is Everywhere and Qniversity is the place where ordinary people share extraordinary knowledge, skills, passions and advice. Along with good food and good company. To be a part at Qniversity you don't need to be an expert, you just have to have passion for something and for letting other people know about it! Do You Have a Passion? A Hidden Skill? Or are you looking to explore something new? Something you have been waiting to share? Personal experience and the desire to share something that you think is valuable - is where its at - at Qniversity!
results.name: Qniversity Lawrence Meetups

results.description:
Boston's transportation system based on 100+ year old technologies such as trains, subways, buses, bikes, and cars. Our system is slow, congested, inconvenient, unreliable, dirty, and inefficient.  We look to change that.  

This group will look at various options and plans for improving the transit system in and around Boston. We hope to come up with a viable options that will both help commuters and businesses as well as hosting large events such as the Olympics. I'm certain that real transit innovations will need to come from outside the status quo. If not us, then who?

Group's link: http://www.meetup.com/New-Transit-Solutions-for-Boston/

Our meetings will usually be at the MS NERD center at One Memorial Drive, Cambridge, MA.
results.name: New Transit Solutions for Boston

results.description:
We connect like-minded individuals to groups, and we connect different groups with each other, for the advancement of fun, education, business, and the greater good. We will be hosting Social Exchange Happy Hours, Social Exchange Brunches, Social Exchange Coffee Breaks, and Social Exchange Intergroup Discussions (to name a few), all in beautiful Boston! 

This group is great for anyone new to the Boston area, anyone looking meet like-minded people, or anyone who is curious as to what else Boston has to offer.  We look forward to meeting you!
results.name: Social Group Exchange, Boston.

results.description: The Nor'easters is the New England chapter of the Association of Proposal Management Professionals (APMP). Through our affiliation with APMP, we seek to promote better business development and capture practices for our members' organizations, and to improve members' professional knowledge and skills. We serve proposal professionals in New England. Our members are employed in the commercial and government sectors and span a variety of industries. Some of us are new to proposal development, while others are seasoned pros. All of us, however, are interested in learning the latest advances in proposal development from like-minded peers and outside consultants. The chapter hosts several in-person and virtual events each year.
results.name: APMP Nor'easters - Advancing Proposal Management Practices

topics.name: MBTI INFJ INFP INTJ INTP ISFJ ISFP ISTJ ISTP HSP

results.description:
• Do you have an unquenchable thirst to know "what, why, and how", to the extent that you've spent hours on wikipedia? 

• Is one of your favorite past times meeting new interesting people? 

• Do you find yourself arguing from one position/perspective only to change to a completely different position mid-discussion? 

• Do you find most things humorous if viewed from the right angle? 

• Do you have a remarkable talent for procrastination? 

• Would you rather invent an automatic bill paying system than write a check? 

• Do you think this picture is amazing? http://sharpwriter.deviantart.com/art/Ben-Franklin-VS-Zeu... 

If so you might identify with the Myers Briggs type of ENTP http://www.16personalities.com/entp-personality. Or perhaps even if this doesn't sound like you, you enjoy the company of this particular brand of weirdo. In any case we would likely have a good time talking about this, that, and the other things.  All are welcome.    

We will keep a loose group structure with polls for activities, and a general focus on having a good time in whatever manner we choose. Some ideas are: cocktails and conversation, lectures then cocktails, cocktails then lectures, game nights, trivia, world domination, dancing, rock climbing, urban safaris, writing workshops, hackathons, etc, etc.   

We will attempt to cajole the INFJ (our supposed best buddies) meetup group into occasional dual events. 

Stop procrastinating and sign up!
results.name: Wild Speculation: ENTPs and Friends

results.description: We're a local group of knitters and crocheters who knit hats & scarves for Bread of Life, hats and mittens for Malden High day care, and blankets and shawls for Hospice Services in Everett. We're sponsored by First Lutheran Church in Malden; we knit as a spiritual practice to help out others, but we like to enjoy each other's company with beer or wine while we do so. Join us, and we'll give you a kit and pointers (if you need them) to get you started.
results.name: Our Hands Knitting Meetup

results.description:
Get a total body workout to tone, shape and lengthen your body in all the right places.  

PILATES, BALLET AND YOGA ALL IN ONE!

Tone it up...in all the right places! If a smaller, flatter waist, firmed, thinner thighs and a round, high bootie sound good to you, then this class is for you. A combination of basic Pilates mat exercises and fundamental ballet and toning moves finished off with some Yoga/stretching to give you the lean, toned look you want without the bulk.

NO EXPERIENCE NECESSARY
OPEN TO THE PUBLIC

*Please bring a mat and towel. 

More at www.amyfournier.com.
results.name: Barre Total Body Workout Meetup of North Andover

results.description:
Greetings!

This group was formed to bring new friends together who believe that exercise doesn't have to be like a thousand tiny deaths from boredom. We aim to create activities where we can get together to be active. Whether just starting out in a healthier lifestyle, or looking to maintain healthy exercise, we welcome all those who enjoy cammeraderie and motivation to get and stay physically active. We can come together at various venues including local parks and recreational areas to enjoy physical activity such as walking, scenic hiking, bicycle riding, or playing catch with footballs, basketballs, baseballs, frisbees etc., and other fun activities. The ultimate goal here is to become regularly active and as an overall result, healthier. 

Some activities could be special events like dancing, stand-up paddle boarding and Tai Chi classes, or rollerblading/skating at a local rink, or perhaps kite flying at a festival.  Other active adventures could include sea and pond/lake swimming, camping, birdwatching/ nature photo walks, star walks, apple picking, joining organized walks for causes and pet walking groups. 

We always welcome suggestions and feedback from our members on how we can stay active without it being a painfully dull routine. 

All ages, genders, social status and activity levels welcome. Let's get together and help motivate each other through fun and physical activity. Life can be better by being active together!

Best Regards, Andrew D.
results.name: Fun and Fit Club

results.description: This group is for anyone in the real estate community that wants to connect and discuss business solutions. We'll also discuss Marketing, strategies,business development and how to get started in real estate investing.
results.name: North Shore Real Estate Investing Meetup

results.description:
This is a Boston Hearthstone Fireside Gathering where we build friendships and play for fun. Sometimes we might announce tournaments, and hopefully get some of our members into the Hearthstone Regionals or the World Championship.

About the Founder

Wankyu is a writer for Blizzplanet.com since 2014. Attended PAX East 2015 as press, and  he was invited by Blizzard Entertainment to attend a private party to play the Hearthstone: Blackrock Mountain adventure.

After talking one-on-one with Eric Dodds and Yong Woo about firesides, Wankyu felt excited and decided to launch a Boston Fireside Gathering.
results.name: Boston Hearthstone Fireside Meetup

results.description: Looking to start a band, or just talk music with like-minded people? Then this is the meetup for you! We will meet 2 times a month to network with local musicians and maybe find your next big project! For certain events, there will be a open jam session.
results.name: Somerville Rock Music Meetup

results.description: Led by Harvard educated, ESL specialist Richard Lambert, this is a friendly English conversation group for learners of all levels. We meet once a week to improve members' speaking, listening, grammar, and writing skills. Some meetings are coupled with cultural events, delicious food, or are focused on specific grammar and/or vocabulary. Let's start speaking!
results.name: Ivy League Speaking English - ESL Meetup Harvard/Boston

results.description: On Thursday, April 9, 2015 entrepreneurs, industry leaders, and investors will have the chance to discover enriching opportunity as Northeastern University’s innovative scholarly achievements are showcased at the 2015 Research, Innovation, and Scholarship Expo (RISE: 2015). Vibrant connections are bound to result as attendees survey over 400 of Northeastern’s solution focused innovations and network with 2000 plus industry and scholarly experts. Assuredly, real world innovation will spark real world opportunity: the next start-up venture will be discovered; the next promising investment identified; the next process advancement discerned; the next exceptional recruit scouted. At RISE: 2015, the horizon of opportunity will be vast.

results.description:
This group is for anyone who interested in networking, connecting, communicating and creating media collaboratively in the greater Somerville community. You will also stay up-to-date about different media production classes and events throughout the year. 

If you would like to register (which costs a fee) for some of our media education classes there are two different rates. One is a member rate and the other is a non-member rate. If you live in Somerville, MA, you can join SCATV as an Equipment Member or Organizational member (if you have a community group or non-profit) and can take our classes at the member rate, and once certified you can reserve our facilities/equipment at no additional cost. If you are not a resident, you can still take our classes but will be charged a rental fee if you wish to use our facilities/equipment after the class. However, you can join as an Equipment Member through an Organizational Membership but this requires you producing programs for that specific group. If you have any questions about membership, please contact us at 617.628.8826 or by email at membership@scatvsomerville.org*


Cheers and let's make media that matters!
results.name: Community Media Collaborative

results.description:
A meetup for people who think outside the box. Soapbox-free. Debate-free. Rant-free. Join us for intriguing, inspirational, mind-expanding conversations on a wide variety of topics.   

"Critical thinking is that mode of thinking — about any subject, content, or problem — in which the thinker improves the quality of his or her thinking by skillfully analyzing, assessing, and reconstructing it. Critical thinking is self-directed, self-disciplined, self-monitored, and self-corrective thinking. It presupposes assent to rigorous standards of excellence and mindful command of their use. It entails effective communication and problem-solving abilities, as well as a commitment to overcome our native egocentrism and sociocentrism."   The Critical Thinking Community
results.name: Up The Rabbit Hole:  Fun with Critical Thinking

results.description: Hello! I'm hoping to organize a book club based in Jamaica Plain for those interested in discussing literature from a feminist perspective. This is a book club for those who enjoy reading and identify as a feminist (who doesn't?!). We will be discussing both fiction and non-fiction works that fall under one or more of the following categories: 1. Written by female authors 2. Feature strong female characters 3. Explore gender, sexuality, race, ethnicity, etc. 4. Advocate gender equality and social justice ALL GENDERS WELCOME! If you're interested please leave a comment!
results.name: Jamaica Plain Feminist Book Club

results.description: Hingham Indoor Soccer is a Meetup group for those who enjoy playing a FRIENDLY game of soccer. This group is for players of all skill levels, men and women, of all ages (18+), and beginners are welcome!
results.name: Hingham Pick up Indoor Soccer Meetup

results.description: This group is designed to educate the beginner to advanced Real Estate Investor, 5 Real Estate Strategies including how to Wholesale, Fix & Flip, Lease Options, Seller Financing and Straight Options. Time-tested Executable Step system that has helped 10's of thousands of people. We meet in various ways such as live workshops and webinars. We look forward to meeting you very soon!
results.name: Boston Real Estate Investing & Marketing Entrepreneurs

results.description:
Philosophic Perspectives is an internet radio show on the ArtistFirst Radio Network that explores interesting and unique perspectives that run the gamut of human experience, from the issues of everyday life to the greater controversies of the modern world. This Meetup site is a community of listeners and potential guests who enjoy (or crave!) philosophically oriented conversation. If you are interested in becoming a guest, the best place to start is by joining the Radio Roundtable Pool at the Social Philosophizers Club, from which members may be selected to participate in radio roundtable discussions. I am also seeking guests from a variety of quarters: authors, artists, filmmakers and others across multidisciplinary fields or genres; if you think you may be a candidate, please get in touch with me, or visit the Creativity Expo.

In addition to occasional get-togethers, members of this group will be regularly invited to join activities sponsored by the Social Philosophizers Club, which sponsors a range of philosophic and intellectual discussion, and cultural events.

Philosophic Perspectives is broadcast live on the first and third Wednesdays of each month, 10pm EST, and you can also download free podcasts of past shows. You can also listen to past shows on my YouTube channel.  Whether your interest is listening to stimulating conversations that challenge your philosophical perspectives, or you are seeking opportunities to participate in the broadcasts and/or discuss your work,  I hope that you join our community!

-– Arthur D. Schwartz, Organizer

Creativity Expo
Social Philosophizers Club
Philosophic Perspectives Radio Show
results.name: Philosophic Perspectives Radio Show

topics.name: Hiking Biking Trekking Camping in the Outdoors

results.description:
This group is for WOMEN who love the outdoors, hike, bike, backpack, climb, walk and just enjoy being outside and enjoy the company of other women. 

We want to create a positive and non-competitive environment for all women to enjoy. 

The Nature Girls Meetup Group is intended to be a fun group for all members. Members join the group freely and can cancel membership at any time.

We are dedicated to outdoor activities combined with fun and laughter. Join us on our weekend and weekday outings of walking in local parks, hiking in the White Mountains, snowshoeing, kayaking, biking, rock climbing etc.. Our outings are NOT hard-core, elite level sporting events, but you do need to be in decent physical condition to participate.

We will practice responsible hiking and hike in smaller groups (max. 15) to limit the impact on nature. The smaller the group the less ground disturbance and noise we will create. Those who will pass through after us will be eternally grateful.

We will stick to the rule to take nothing but pictures and leave nothing but footprints. 

Suggestions for events are always welcome and encouraged, and all members are eligible to act as  Event Host for the Nature Girls after attending 3 events, and with the approval of Nature Girls organizers. 

Membership agreement, details and fine print:

NATURE GIRLS CODE OF CONDUCT AND DISCLAIMER: In order to participate in any Nature Girls activity, you acknowledge and agree that this activity involves inherent risks that can cause property damage, injury, illness, disability, and/or death to participants and/or others. * You assume all risk associated with this activity. * You are responsible for having the necessary knowledge, skills, abilities, clothing, and equipment to safely participate in this activity. * In the event of a hiking event, you know and will follow the Hiker Responsibility Code described at hikesafe.com. * You release, hold harmless, and indemnify the leader(s) and all members of this group on the hike and others in the group from any and all claims for property damage, injury, illness, disability, and/or death - including those caused by negligence and/or other reasons. * The description of the event may contain some errors.  You acknowledge that this description is only a guide. * In the event of a hike, labels of "beginner", "intermediate", and "advance" are subjective and depend on the experience of the hiker.  Distance and elevation gained are only approximate.  GPS coordinates are approximate, best viewed using Google Maps. Car, cell phone, and handheld GPS'es vary in accuracy and may not correspond to the meetup location. * The equipment list is a requirement for participation.  If you do not have the required gear, you may not be able to participate. * If you sign up for the event, but change your mind, you must update your RSVP to NO.
results.name: Nature Girls

results.description: This is a group for young adults in their 20s and 30s who need some help making friends and meeting people. We will find a fun activity such as game nights or going out to dinner in or near Cambridge to meet and practice making conversation and participating in group activities. This group is meant for people who have deficits in their social skills and would like to improve these skills in a low-stress, comfortable environment with others who might struggle from the same issues. It is also open to those who feel they have no problems with social skills but would like to participate in our activities and be a good model for appropriate social skills for others. While we have fun engaging in activities, we will also be working on introducing ourselves and making small talk.
results.name: Cambridge Young Adults Social Skills Group

results.description: New to Boston and surrounding area......The Dungeon Society is a BDSM club for open minded adults who enjoy exploring sexuality through consensual voyeurism and consensual participation. We stage monthly parties for our members pleasure throughout the Boston area. Membership is completely confidential and must be pre-approved by the organizer. We caution you to utilize an alternate email address for club communication. Additionally, there is an exclusive annual participatory membership fee as well as a ticket fee per party you choose to attend (varies based upon entertainment/venue costs). This is a standard practice for our members. Please join us in this fulfilling fantasy experience.
results.name: The Dungeon Society

topics.name: Art Creating Art and Perfecting Our Art

results.description: Calling all creatives with visual art and/or writing know-how, to create and share techniques and knowledge of tools & materials. Using art journals as diaries, we will meet to write, draw, print, glue, paint, ink, etc. to express emotions, life challenges, and explore pathways to personal growth.
results.name: North Shore Art Journals

results.description:
More Joy Boston:

Joy is EMOTIONAL OXYGEN, we need it to breathe deeply, every day. So, you do not need to be on a joy diet!

Energize your love life, discover your life purpose, and experience them light each other up!

More Joy Boston is a community of allies who enjoy conscious, creative, and outrageously fun Meetups! Our programs include:

• Playshops, such as "The Fireball Playshops" - improv theater classes about healthy and fun dating & relationships, and "The Life Purpose Time Machine Playshop" - get in (the Time Machine) and "test drive" possible future paths

• Workshops, such as "Great Boundaries" - a serious AND playful journey about developing great personal boundaries (get better at saying "no" and saying "yes" to create your best life)!

• Dynamic speaking engagements on provocative topics, such as "More Joy: Love, Sex, and Life Purpose"

• Highly interactive game nights, such as "Joy Time," a.k.a. "Gotta' Get My Joy Time!"

• Out-of-the-box outdoor journeys, such as "Couples Teambuilding Adventures"


Personal Growth meets FUN! Most events will be held in Harvard Square. Join us!

1. Meet great people
2. Have much more fun than you think you'll have
3. Learn how to manifest more joy in your life, present and future (Joy is the Fountain of Youth)
4. Practice experiencing more joy in the moment (at our events) - expand your capacity for joy

Enjoy your journey more than ever before!


Daniel Phoenix, MA, received his Masters in Counseling Psychology from the California Institute of Integral Studies, and his Bachelors in Socio-Cultural Anthropology from Tufts University. He has been a speaker, workshop/seminar leader, and More Joy coach, since 1995. Daniel also loves scuba-diving and thunderstorms, but not at the same time.
results.name: More Joy Boston - Gotta' Get Our Joy Time

topics.name: Planetary and Human Shift in Consciousness

results.description:
The Oneness Blessing (also known as Deeksha which is Sanskrit for "blessing" or "benediction") is the transfer of intelligent sacred energy - Divine Grace - which causes the heart to flower, heals relationships, quiets the constant chatter of the mind, opens the door to higher states of awareness and initiates a process of permanent awakening into Oneness where there is no longer a sense of separation and personal suffering. All that remains is causeless love, joy and peace in the present moment.

We start the circle the Chakra Dhyana followed by the Oneness Blessings. We allow time for integration of the blessings and sharing.

The Chakra Dhyana is an ancient technique from Tibet and India. It helps to enliven kundalini, a latent spiritual energy which when awakened flows through the Chakras, opening up higher dimensions in human consciousness. The meditation helps to expand consciousness in a way which relaxes the mind, balances the emotions and rejuvenates the body. The meditation includes the chanting of powerful mantras, including the "bija mantras" (or seed sounds) for the chakras, and a visualization of kundalini energy as a golden fluid flowing into the chakras.
results.name: Natick Weekly Oneness Blessing Circle

results.description: Are you a family with young children living in a Greater Boston community searching for appropriate programming, fun activities, classes, workshops, events, and expert parenting support? Then this is the group for you! Instead of having to search each town's separate resources, this group will collect and share information appropriate for families with young children (infancy- elementary years) in the Greater Boston area (communities within 128). Welcome!
results.name: Families with Young Children in Greater Boston

results.description: Do you still have a passion for climbing but have young kids that make it a bit tough to get out there? Join us in day trip and weekend camping adventures where we'll have extra adults along to watch the kids so we can take turns climbing. Rumney, North Conway and local Boston area crags--anywhere we can climb and hang out and provide some entertainment for the little ones.
results.name: Boston area climbers with kids

results.description: This is a two hour training. This training is useful if you want to memorize more easily or want to keep your brain active and your mind sharper. It’s useful for: actors, seniors, students, singers, presenters, business people, hobbyists, the absent minded and others. You’ll be surprised at how well you can memorize anything of any type and length including: names, faces, numbers, languages (foreign and English), speeches, presentations, scripture, facts, data, songs, product information and course work. You’ll learn various methods including the historic “memory palace”. And you will discover that memorizing can be an easy, creative and enjoyable process.
results.name: Waltham Memory Training Meetup

results.description:
This training is useful if you want to memorize more easily or want to keep your brain active and your mind sharper. It’s useful for: actors, seniors, students, singers, presenters, business people, hobbyists, the absent minded and others. You’ll be surprised at how well you can memorize anything of any type and length including: names, faces, numbers, languages (foreign and English), speeches, presentations, scripture, facts, data, songs, product information and course work. You’ll learn various methods including the historic “memory palace”. And you will discover that memorizing can be an easy, creative and enjoyable process.

This is what one recent student has to say: “A remarkably useful program. One of the best presentations of memory related material I have seen. Neil’s presentations were a pleasure to be at. The methods really work and are very well thought through and presented in a very entertaining way.” Dr. Mark Kon, Professor of Mathematics, Boston University
results.name: Memory Training Meetup

results.description: A group for (Dutch) people interested in meeting up with (Dutch) people to talk (Dutch) and have some (Dutch) fun. Gezellig!
results.name: Boston Anything Dutch Meetup

results.description:
TeamAIDAsha is a beginner-friendly marathon/half-marathon training and fundraising program. We train runners for full or half marathon races (Marine Corps Marathon in DC or Baystate full/half marathon in Lowell), and runners raise funds for AID and Asha.

Who should join?

• Anyone from couch potatoes to experienced runners 

• Anyone looking for a challenging activity this summer

• Anyone looking to make a difference in the world

Membership benefits:

• Detailed 25-week training plan with group runs every Saturday (starting on April 11th) until race day

• Coaching support, Fundraising support, Mentorship by alumni runners

• Entry into Marine Corps Marathon in DC (Oct 25th) or Baystate full/half marathon in Lowell (Oct 18th)

• Water support during group runs

• Social events and life-long friendships

About the TeamAIDAsha

This team is jointly organized by volunteers from the Boston/MIT chapters of Association for India's Development (AID) and Asha for Education. We have been running this program since 2003. We have trained hundreds of runners to complete their first marathon or half-marathon.  For more information please visit our website at: http://www.teamaidasha.org/information-session-materials.html

Lawyers make us do this :-).  By joining the TeamAIDAsha program and runs you are agreeing to our official waiver at: http://www.teamaidasha.org/waiver.html
results.name: TeamAIDAsha Marathon Training Program

results.description:
Boston Pride Hockey (BPH) was formed in the early 1990's as a local club team.

The goal of our hockey club is to provide a place where people of any gender identity and/or sexual orientation can participate in a sport they love and enjoy the company of like-minded individuals. Boston Pride Hockey is proud to have a diverse membership representing a broad spectrum of gender identity, orientation, and hockey skill level. We welcome everyone to play or watch (we love our fans!) and to be a member of Boston Pride Hockey.

http://www.bostonpridehockey.org/about.html
results.name: Boston Pride Hockey

results.description:
Classy Ladies are invited to join and meet new friends who have a positive outlook on life!  Let's get out and explore areas on the South Shore, and from Newport to Boston. Activities will include live music venues, museums, drinks and conversation, walking tours, concerts, sporting events, light fitness and cultural events.

Please have a photograph of yourself as your profile picture.  We ask this for the comfort of all members, and it is helpful to be able to recognize your smiling face when you attend a meet up.

Most events will be geared towards singles but all Classy Ladies are welcome! Ages recommended are 35+ years. It's time to enjoy life and start goin' out!
results.name: Classy Ladies Goin' Out  35+

results.description: EDM/LA is a group for those interested in educational data mining, data science, data analytics, and learning sciences. My objective is to develop a community here in Boston to support collaboration and scientific development in this new discipline. This meetup will bring together professionals who would like to share their knowledge and/or gain understanding of recent methods, techniques, and theories of the field. As an administrator of this meetup, I aim to provide both technical and theoretical options for each meetup in order to serve the needs of a wider audience.
results.name: Educational Data Mining/Learning Analytics

results.description: Let's play at the beach! Surfers, stand up paddleboarders & loungers.  Some of you might only come out when it's warm but others may be avid ocean lovers and go out all year round in your wetsuits or travel to the beach in the winter. This is a group to bring us like-minded watermen and waterwomen together in the Boston area. Beaches closeby for surfer are Nantucket Beach in Hull or Nahant Beach in Lynn. We often go to Jenness in Rye or Rhode Island as well.   Please feel free to suggest your own location or your own meetup event dates under the SUGGEST A MEETUP tab.  The organizer, Stacey Mac, is a competitive Stand Up Paddlesurfer and Stand Up Paddleboard ("SUP") and Surf instructor with companies doing the same in Boston & Costa Rica. She also customizes vacation packages to Costa Rica for sup, surf, yoga or general leisure travel.  www.SUPSONAS.com. The assistant event organizers are Denise & Russ who are also avid surfers and ocean lovers.  Stacey, Denise & Russ are the 3 muskateers and are out there even in the winter or travel south to surf.  All 3 of them also love to snowboard, so feel free to add any ski or snowboard trips, even though Stacey is in Costa Rica most of the winter.
results.name: Boston Beach Fun with Surfing & Stand Up Paddleboarding

results.description: Whether you're new to the city or a lifelong Bostonian, this is a group for anyone who wants to explore and learn more about Boston. I grew up in Massachusetts and I moved to Boston last year. I started this group to meet other people who want to explore the city for great restaurants, shows, exhibits, tours, etc. There are no limits. We can be on Newbury Street for Brunch one afternoon or hit a local dive bar in the South End later that evening. I work in the hospitality (hotel) industry and I've learned so much about the Boston restaurant scene at work. Everyone is welcome to join. If you're new to Boston this group is a great way to meet new people and experience everything Boston has to offer.
results.name: Lets Find Something New In Boston: 20's and 30's

topics.name: All male four part harmony chorus

results.description: We meet every week to sing close 4 part harmony, socialize and have fun. We sing traditional and modern barbershop songs and perform throughout Eastern Mass. All men with some singing background are welcome, you do not have to have musical training or be able to read music.
results.name: MetroWest A Capella/New Sound Assemby Chorus

results.description:
LyceumLive was founded on the idea that critical information leads to inspiration. We KNOW our world needs change NOW. In our hearts we are called to be a part of that change but may feel sidelined by lack of information and resources. And by the fear of striking out on our own

LyceumLive provides  the way forward. By connecting thought leaders with curious seekers a dialogue ensues ,inspiration fuels collaboration and transformation results.

Come meet your tribe organically. Pick a topic or series of topics that peak your interest. Learn from an expert while connecting with a roomful of like minded individuals. Share a beverage and conversation. Challenge convention. Brainstorm. Follow the energy, you never know where it will lead! 


We are looking for all kinds of passionate individuals who are seeking change or maybe just curious if there is a better way than the status quo. ( You know there has to be!!)

Come to be informed, learn a little , connect with kindred spirits, be inspired to take the next step on your journey.

If you have a topic that you would like to share with the group, please contact Rose@lyceumLive.com
results.name: LyceumLive

results.description: About NBWS: The National Black Women's Society (NBWS), formerly Young Black Women’s Society (NBWS), a 501(C) (3), membership based organization was founded on March 5, 2005 in Dorchester, Massachusetts. Five dynamic women of color recognized the absence of a Boston- based organization that offered young professional women of color the necessary platform for leadership and support to realize their full potential. Today it has emerged as the only leading organization in Boston that targets emerging women of color who are looking to develop their personal, professional and civic lives. We have hosted over 100 events and programs and impacted the lives of over 500 women through the years. We continue to use our leadership, creativity and influence to shine a positive light on women of color in this region and beyond.
results.name: National Black Women's Society

results.description:
Hello Ballroom Dance Fans! 

Our Ballroom Meetup welcomes dancers of all ages and all experience levels to meet up at the Star Dance School for our monthly Ballroom Dance Parties! 

How It Works: 

Join us for our Second Saturday Social Series. Yes, you guessed it! The SECOND SATURDAY of every month at 8:00PM we host a Ballroom Dance Party at our studio in Brighton. 

An intro lesson for those interested begins at 8:00PM and our dance party begins at 8:30PM. General Admission is $5/person. 

The address is: Star Dance Studio 323 Washington Street Brighton, MA Parking: There is some limited parking behind the studio, but that tends to fill up quickly! There is street parking however that is free after 6PM on Washington Street. 

Feel free to contact the Admin with any questions or also the Star Dance School at info@StarDanceSchool.com or via phone at 617-202-9200. Don't forget to check out our ballroom dance social FAQ's below! 

------------------------------------------------------------------------

What is a “Ballroom Social”? 

A ballroom social is a dance party featuring ballroom dance styles. Music is played for Standard and Smooth styles such as waltz, foxtrot, and tango as well as Latin and Rhythm styles including salsa, rumba, cha-cha, and the like. At Star Dance’s Socials an optional 30 minute group dance lesson kicks off the evening as well! 

What on earth should I wear?! 

Smart-casual to elegant attire is encouraged, but most importantly wear clothing you can move around in comfortably. If you do not have ballroom shoes often a light weight dress shoe will do the trick. *Note: Please avoid sneakers, or metal spike-heel shoes as they can damage our floor. Thank you for your understanding!* 

Do I need a partner? 

Partners are welcome, but not required to enjoy a night out on the town with us! Social dancing is a fantastic way to make new friends and we encourage dancers to rotate partners in order to meet new people. 

Do I need prior dance experience? 

Whether it is your first time dancing or you have years of ballroom under your belt, all levels are welcome to attend our socials!
results.name: Star Dance School Ballroom Meetup!
